Work Experience

-4/27/2015-Current
National Institutes of Health (National Institute of Mental Health), Maryland, United States
 Clinical Research Coordinator 

Examine clinically relevant documents and write narratives. Enter and extract data into and from custom databases, including toxicological analyses results. Maintain detailed records of the documents requested and obtained in accordance with the standard operating procedures. Call next-of-kin to request agreements to release medical records and other documents. Coordinate with doctors and hospital administrators to obtain medical records on the selected cases. Maintain result records according to standard operating procedures. Prepare clinical protocols for review by the Institutional Review Board (IRB). Communicate basic lab needs for both technical and administrative issues to laboratory senior staff. Assist in daily functioning responsibilities and performance of general laboratory duties expected of the NIMH laboratory in coordination with laboratory senior staff. Participate in lab meetings and generate ideas for improving efficiency and productivity in the laboratorys operations. 

-09/2013 - 09/2013
University of South Alabama Medical Center-Department of Infectious Disease
 Mobile, Alabama
      Observership 
      Attending Physician:  Dr. Eduardo G. Calderon, M.D.
	I completed a 2 week observership in Infectious Disease.  My duties included participating in the consultations requested by the ward team.  I rounded on the patients, reviewed the their medical chart in order to compose and present an assessment and plan under the supervision of the Attending Physician to the consulting team.

-08/2013 - 09/2013
University of South Alabama Medical Center, 
Mobile, Alabama
      Observership
      Attending Physician:  Dr. John Schultz, M.D.
      	I completed a 4 week clinical observership in Internal Medicine working within the Ward team in the inpatient setting. My duties included taking medical histories, conducting physicals examinations, composing an assessment and plan under the supervision of the senior resident physician for new admitting patients from the Emergency Department and following them and participating in daily rounds throughout their inpatient stay.  I participated in morning report and noon conference on a daily basis.

-October 2011  January 2012
Covenant Health System 
Lubbock, TX
      Observership 
      Attending Physician:  Dr. Piyush Mittal, M.D.
	I completed a 12 week observsership in Internal Medicine at Covenant Medical Group in Lubbock, TX.  My responsibilities included taking histories and performing physical exams on patients followed by case presentations under the direct supervision of the Attending Physician, as well as, scribing their treatment plans in an easy to understand format.

-March 2010  - June 2011
RSA Medical LLC.
      Naperville, IL
Position: Medical Risk Assessment Case Manager
         My responsibilities included using medical knowledge to evaluate and utilize strong writing skills to record patients reported medical records, history, and personal interview against any past medical claim history to assess their overall medical risk for the application for medical insurance, as well as, accurately review medical records and medical record abstractions for consistency and completeness.

-June 1999  October 2002
Saint Anthony Hospital
Oklahoma City, Oklahoma
Position:  Pharmacy Technician/Intern
     My responsibilities included dispensing medication to the floors, entering and processing medication orders, and preparation and compounding certain medications i.e. hyperailmentation  IV solutions, ointments, and elixirs.

Volunteer Experience

-September 2013 - April 2014
Ochsner Behavorial Medicine -New Orleans, LA
Volunteering in assisting the counselors of the treatment center by conducting history taking and patient interviewing, as well as, case management for follow up patients.

-April 2013  August 2013
Manor on the Hill -Alzheimers Care Unit;  Leominster, MA
Volunteering as an aide at an Alzheimers Care Unit within an Assisted Living Community.   My duties include working closely with the Activities Coordinator to engage and help our Alzheimer residents participate in activities that fulfills their emotional, physical, and social needs.

-January 2012  May 2012
University Medical Center at Texas Tech University-Chemotherapy Infusion Clinic; Lubbock, TX
My responsibilities included providing comfort to patients receiving scheduled chemotherapy treatments, as well as, maintaining operational status of the clinic by checking in patients, recording their vitals, assorting and delivering patients medical charts and delivering blood samples to the lab. 


-February/2004, June/2004, July/2005
Community Health Fair; Nevis, West Indes
I participated in organizing and conducting a series of health fairs on the island of Nevis during my second, third, and fifth semesters of basic sciences.  My responsibilities included educating the citizens about HIV prevention, as well as, screening the citizens for Hypertension and Diabetes.

Hobbies and Interests
-My interests include playing volleyball, listening to music, photography, and watching movies.

Type at 40 words per minute.

Awards and Honors
Woman of Courage Award.  University of Washington Women’s Center.	2015
Affiliations/Licensure/Certifications
•	American Academy of Nursing, Fellow
•	Certified Registered Nurse (Swedish licensure)
•	Certified Registered Nurse (Washington State licensure)
•	Teaching Certification (Swedish licensure)
•	Washington State Nurses Association
•	American Nursing Association 
Service Activities (current, partial list)
•	Reviewer for seven scholarly journals
•	The Hope Heart Institute, Seattle (advisory board)
•	American Assn. of Colleges of Nursing (Advisory Group on Diversity and Inclusion Excellence) 
•	American Assn. of Colleges of Nursing (Government Affairs Committee) 
•	American Assn. of Colleges of Nursing (Doctoral Education Conference, 
PhD Summit Planning Committee) 
•	American Assn. of Colleges of Nursing (Steering Committee, Organizational Leadership Network)
•	American Assn. of Colleges of Nursing (Chair, Planning Committee, Organizational Leadership Network)
•	University of Washington Club (Board of Trustees)
•	Center for Leadership Formation (Health Leadership Advisory Board) Swedish Medical Center, Seattle
•	Ph.D. advisor (chair), Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden
•	More than 20 different media events on the topic of aging and/or elderly immigrants in daily newspapers, TV and radio programs, and educational videos
Research
My areas of research expertise include issues surrounding transcultural care, particularly of the elderly. 
I have worked in a series of international research collaborations with, among others, the University of California, San Francisco; University of Sheffield, U.K.; Universidad de Chile, Chile; and the University of Alberta, Canada. I have also initiated development of a joint Ph.D. program involving the Karolinska Institutet, Department of Neurobiology, Care Sciences and Society (Sweden) and the University of Social Welfare and Rehabilitation Sciences, Iran Medical University, and the Medical University of Isfahan, Iran. I served as the director of this successful international joint doctoral program. 
To date, I have more than 70 publications including articles in refereed international and Swedish journals, three book chapters and two scientific reports. I have been awarded more than $6 million in grants and endowments to support my research and that of my doctoral students. I serve on the editorial boards and/or as a reviewer for six peer-reviewed journals. I have been chairwoman of seven national and international committees, in addition to serving on a number of evaluation committees for national and international grants in Sweden, e.g. Vice Chair of the Karolinska University Hospital Committee for Research and Education (FoUU).
My research projects, in progress and completed, include:
•	Participant and co-supervisor for “Implementation and evaluation of music therapeutic caregiving-Interventions in Dementia Care” 
•	Primary investigator for the project “Experiences of life situations for relatives of dementia sufferers in rural areas and large cities” 
•	Primary investigator for “Perceptions on and experiences of dementia among patients, families and professional caregivers in Iran and Sweden,” a joint PhD program between the Karolinska Institutet and Iranian universities.
•	Primary investigator for “Gender perspectives in elderly care–contributions, expectations and everyday life among nursing staff and family members”
•	Primary investigator for “Developing cultural competence and preventing discrimination in care”
•	Primary investigator for “Informal care giving of dementia patients in Iran: health status, care burden, and expressed needs family care- givers”
•	Primary Investigator for “Cultural knowledge growth and cultural competence in care”
•	Worked in a series of international research collaborations including with the University of California, San Francisco; University of Sheffield, U.K.; Universidad de Chile, Chile; and the University of Alberta, Canada. 
Conference Participation and Presentations (partial list)
•	Emami, Azita. “Developing Transcultural Competence to Prevent Discrimination in Elderly Care.” Panel presentation at the Third International Conference on Prevention and Management of Chronic Conditions, Bangkok, Thailand. February 2015.
•	Marmstål, L., Emami, A., Engström, G, and Götell, E.  “Caregivers´experience of music thrapeutic careiving in dementia care” Muntlig presentation, 18th Alzheimer’s Conference Europe, Oslo (Engelsk presentation). May 2008.
•	Marmstål, L., Emami, A., Engström, G, and Götell, E. “Vårdares efrenheter av vårdarsång i demensvård,” Muntlig presentation, 18th Alzheimer’s Conference Europe, Oslo (Svensk presentation). May 2008.
•	Marmstål, L., Emami, A., Engström, G, and Götell, E. “Caregivers´experience of music thrapeutic careiving in dementia care,” Muntlig presentation, NCCS conference, Borås. April 2008.
•	Marmstål, L., Emami, A., Engström, G, and Götell, E. “Implementation and evaluation of music therapeutic caregiving,” Poster och muntlig presentation, 7th Conference on Advances in Health Care Science Research, Stockholm. August 2007.
•	 Jirwe, M., Gerrish, K., & Emami, A. “The Delphi technique: methodological and practical consideration.” Royal College of Nursing, Dundee, England. January 2007.
•	  “Moving to and living in a retirement home–Focusing on elderly people’s sense of safety and security.” 18th Nordic Congress of Gerontology,  Jyväskylä, Finland. May 2006.
•	    Jirwe, M., Gerrish, K., & Emami, A. “The theoretical framework of cultural competence.” Conference of the Transcultural Nursing Society, New York, USA. October 2005.

column108: BEFIKADU L. WUBISHET 1/35 Robinson Avenue, Lambton NSW 2299 Cellphone: +614 7875 9801 E-mail: befikadulegesse.wubishet@uon.edu.au Professional Summary After more than six years of experience as an academic and related education in Pharmacy and Health Science, I am at my highest level of determination to become a prominent professional in Health Economics. I am proficient in teaching, health economic evaluation and modeling, manuscript and research proposal writing, conducting structured literature reviews and making lucid presentations. Work Experience 09/2014–present Student Digital Ambassador, Karolinska Institute, Stockholm, Sweden • Blogged about my experience as a student at my University and life in Stockholm and Sweden, • Welcomed, guided and shadowed prospective students about their study plans at KI, • Posted pictures, related to education and student life in Stockholm, on social media, • Worked at campus events (seminars, trainings and conferences), • Assisted campus Swedish language courses 09/2008–07/2014 Lecturer, Mekelle University, Ethiopia • Offered various courses to undergraduate pharmacy and other health science students. • Advised and examined graduating class students’ researches. • Supervised students’ practical attachments. • Provided community service. • Conducted researches. • Coordinated Community Based Education Office of College of Health Sciences. • Organized six-weeks breast cancer awareness creation radio program in Mekelle town, Ethiopia 10/2010–09/2012 Part-time Instructor and Pharmacy Department Head, Atlas College of Health Sciences, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia • Offered various courses to undergraduate Pharmacy students. • Advised and examining graduating class students’ researches. • Handled managerial issues of the department. 04/2012–07/2013 International Citizenship Service Volunteer, Voluntary Service Overseas-Ethiopia • Worked in primary schools’ environmental health and anti-HIV/AIDS clubs. • Gave health education, care for elderly people at Mekedonia Home for the Elderly, and Mentally Disabled. • Helped special needs class students in schools by giving them vocational training. • Conducted English tutorial classes in orphanages. • Organized events and raised 11,000 ETB to support street children and HIV/AIDS orphans. • Organized six community action days to create awareness on major health problems. Education 11/2016–to date PhD in Gender and Health (Thesis tile: Health care utilization and health economics of diabetes among women in Australia) 09/2014–06/2016 Master in Public Health Sciences-Health Economics, Policy and Management, Karolinska Institute, Sweden (Thesis title: Model Development for and Preliminary Assessment of Real World Cost Effectiveness of Novel Oral Anticoagulants among Atrial Fibrillation Patients in Sweden) 11/2010–07/2013 Master in Pharmacoepidemiology and Social Pharmacy, Addis Ababa University, Ethiopia (training completed, original degree document not received) 09/2004–06/2008 Bachelor of Science in Pharmacy, Jimma University, Ethiopia Certification and Training • Professional Registration and Licensing in Ethiopia: Chief Pharmacist • Certificate in Introduction to Systematic Review and Meta-analysis (Online: https://www.coursera.org/account/accomplishments/verify/PMWKVS6BEC) • Certificate of completion in the following courses:  Introduction to Modeling Methods,  Statistical Methods in Economic Evaluations,  Meta-Analysis and Systematic Literature Reviews in comparative Effectiveness Research,  Introduction to Big Data Analysis. Research Activities • Won three national and university level research grants in Ethiopia, • Authored and co-authored eleven original research articles in international peer-reviewed journals with three more currently on correspondence • Made oral and poster research presentations at national and international conferences such as International Society for Pharmacoeconomics and Outcomes Research 20th international meeting, 13th World Congress on Public Health. Skills Language: Amharic (mother tongue), English (full professional fluency), Swedish (intermediate) Computer and Software: Microsoft office applications, Epi-info, SPSS, Endnote, Treeage Transferable: Adaptable to situations, punctual, able to think ahead, dependable, energetic Professional: Teaching, research grant writing, conducting research, scientific paper writing Scholarships and Travel Grants • University of Newcastle Tuition Fee Scholarship (UNIPRS) with University of Newcastle Living Allowance Scholarship (UNRSC 50:50) • Swedish Institute Study Scholarship-Category I (2014-16) • ISPOR 20th International Meeting Student Travel Grant Association Memberships International Society for Pharmacoeconomics and Outcomes Research, Australian Health Economics Society, Ethiopian Pharmaceutical Association, Ethiopian Public Health Association. column108: "November, 2016. To: IHME I am Bedilu Abebe who is a Masters of public health in Reproductive health and wants to pursue PhD in your institution. I graduated from the former Debub University(later Hawassa) with Bachelor of science in public health profession in 2006 masters of public health in reproductive health from Jimma university in 2014. Now, I am public health department head at Debre Tabor University, college of Health Sciences, Ethiopia. I had been assigned by the ministry of health and I have worked in Oromia region, as a clinician, IDSR Focal person and head of health center. Since August 2014, I am lecturer and social and population health coordinator at Debre Tabor University. I was involved in different consultancy activities with Alliance for Better Health (ABH), Ethiopian Public Health institute (EPHI) and Beta consultancy targeted on different health affairs. Generally, I have work experience of about eight years as clinician, head of the health center, as a lecturer and coordinator in higher education institution. I have competence certificate on the clinical nursing demonstrations by national center of competence. In addition, I am a member of the EPHA (Ethiopian Public Health Association) for the last seven years. I have one research article published by BMC Women’s Health titled ""Determinants of intimate partner violence during pregnancy among married women in Abay Chomen district, Western Ethiopia: a community based oss sectional study."" accessed at Abebe Abate et al. BMC Women's Health (2016) 16:16 DOI 10.1186/s12905-016-0294-6. My interest of PHD research is “determinants of infant survival born from mothers living with HIV” A cohort study. Therefore I am confident that I may satisfy your vacancy and hope to be part of your organization. I have attached my CV and copy of necessary documents to this application letter. I will try to analyze within short period of time & interventions options will be forwarded soon. Thank you for your time and consideration. Bedilu Abebe CURRICULUM VITAE PERSONAL INFORMATION Full name Bedilu Abebe Abate Age 29 Sex Male Marital status: Single Nationality Ethiopian Place of birth Fincha town, Ethiopia. Date of birth May23, 1977 E.C. (30th, May, 1986) Current address Debre Tabor town, 01 Kebele. Phone number 0912-858257/094-6465577 E-mail address bediluab@gmail.com abebebedilu@yahoo.com LANGUAGE ABILITY Amharic Excellent in speaking, writing & reading. English Excellent in speaking, writing & reading Afan Oromo Excellent in speaking, writing & reading EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION Qualification: MPH/Reproductive health University: Jimma University Faculty: Faculty of Public Health and Medical sciences Year: 2014 Qualification: BSc (Public Health Officer) University: Debub/Hawassa University Faculty: Faculty of Public Health Year: 2006 PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCES 4.1. Past assignments and responsibilities Position : Heath Center Head, Lecturer, Département Head Organization : Gudeya Bila, Nekemte, Debre Tabor, Ethiopia Date : September 2006- 2015 Job Responsibilities Diagnosis, treatment, admission of severe cases, Referral of cases that need higher level care and prevention of acute and chronic diseases. Organize, with my colleagues, a voluntary counseling and testing (VCT) week Gudeya Bila Health center participating communities. Train and empower members of Anti-HIV/AIDS student Club members on incorporating HIV/AIDS in their club activities. Training is given as focused group discussion on condom use, spread of HIV/AIDS prevalence and spread and facts and myths about HIV/AIDS and related issues. Collects and disseminates information about proposal opportunities for funding and announcements of funding agencies. Mentors faculty students in proposal development and the conduct of research. Guides their growth and facilitates the achievement of their individual goals. Promotes group projects within the public health unit and a oss disciplines that fall into the defined focal areas. Teaching courses for graduate Medical students and undergraduate public health officer and nursing students. Creates a positive research environment through opportunities to learn, share and receive rewards. Negotiates research partnerships with health care agencies to engage faculty and students in public health projects. USAID transaction program facility level coordinator and OPD worker. COMPUTER SKILL ___________________________________________________________ MS word MS excel MS power Point Epi data version 3.5.1 data entry Statistical package for social sciences (SPSS version 20.00) data analysis and interpretation Qualitative (Thematic) data analysis i.e. FGDs and in depth interview experience in concern world wide MARPS program Country base line assessment. 6. TRAININGS AND CERTIFICATES ___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ PIHCT (provider initiated HIV counseling& testing) by Oromia health bureau &FHI. Ethiopian contraceptive logistic system by USAID. IMNCI training by Regional health bureau and UNICEF. ICCM Training by JSI and Zonal health bureau. Training on TB/HIV organized by ORHB and WHO ART training by FHI. IDSR (integrated disease surveillance & reporting) by east Wollega zone health office & WHO. Training on health care financing (HCF) by zonal health office. Certificate of competence against clinical nursing demonstrations. Training on long term contraceptive by FHI Ethiopia. Training on Comprehensive post Abortal /PAC/ care by Marie Stopes international. Training on STIs diagnosis and treatment by WHO and regional health. Office. Training on malaria Diagnosis and treatment by ORHB and WHO. PMTCT training by ICAP and Oromia regional health bureau. Training on HMIS by Oromia Health bureau and Tulane University. Certificate of merit for group’s best performance from Jimma university community based education coordinating office. Research methods, research ethics and grant writing by MEPI(Medical Education Partner Initiative) and Debre Tabor university ,2015. Effective teaching skill by Jhpeigo and Debre Tabor university , 2014. Problem based learning by Jhpeigo and Debre Tabor university, 2015. Successful scientific writing and effective oral communication by MEPI(Medical Education Partner Initiative) and Addis Ababa university . 8. REFERENCES Bitiya Admassu (Bsc, MPH,Ass. column108: ______________________________________________________________________________ CURRICULUM VITAE Dr. Anurag Bhargava M.B.B.S., M.D. (Medicine), M.Sc. (Epidemiology), McGill University, Montreal, Canada. 1990 MD (Internal Medicine), All-India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi, India. 1986 MB BS, Government Medical College, Nagpur University, India. PROFESSIONAL OBJECTIVES To become a public health-oriented clinician and researcher, achieving a synthesis of clinical medicine and public health. To conduct research at clinical and community levels into public health problems —communicable diseases, especially tuberculosis, nutrition, and non-communicable diseases such as diabetes. To train and empower medical personnel in India in clinical medicine, clinical and community based research, and itical appraisal of medical literature. column95: IHME received author form
column108:
Amanuel Alemu Abajobir
                                                                                                        Tel: +61 490 403 414  		                                                                                                        E-mail: a.abajobir@uq.edu.au or amanuel.abajobir@uqconnect.edu.au
                                                                                                        Date:   March 30, 2016
To:     GBD management team
       Subject:     Letter of intent

Dear sir/madam,
I would like to express my intent to get involved in academic activities as a co-author in GBD. I have a Master of Public Health (MPH) in Reproductive and Family Health (RFH) from Addis Ababa University, School of Public Health (in 2012), BSc. Degree in Public Health (equivalent to GP) from Hawassa University, College of Health Sciences and Referral Hospital (in 2009) and have taken supplementary certified short-term trainings from various institutions including John Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health and Teaching and Learning Clinic by UQ graduate school for professional development. I have worked as a Lecturer, Public Health Researcher and Research and Publication Officer in Debremarkos University, College of Medicine and Health Sciences, Ethiopia and Senior Research Officer at School of Pharmacy of The University of Queensland, Australia. I have provided consultancy/supervisory services both for governmental and non-governmental (e.g., UNFPA) institutions and currently undertaking my PhD program (in Paediatrics and Reproductive Medicine (50%) + Public Health and Health Services (50%)) at School of Public Health of The University of Queensland, Australia. I have good experiences in areas of health systems research both in quantitative and qualitative methods with over 20 publications on peer-reviewed reputable international journals and 9 on national research proceedings of universities or other independent organizations and many more ongoing manuscripts at different stages. I am a registered peer-reviewer for high quality journals including BMC, Journal of Maternal and Child Health, Paediatrics and Journal of Affective Disorders. Moreover, I am Life Time member of EPHA.
I have decent communication skills and experiences of report compilation and analysis. I have also knowledge and skill of basic computer programs like MS word, MS Excel, MS access, database management and furthermore, familiar with SPSS, Epi-info, EpiData, OpenCode Software, Open Epi, STATA software packages, Spectrum suite for RH/FP programs planning and management. 
I would be pleased if you consider me in your esteemed team where I can contribute to the best of my knowledge and concurrently be introduced to your experiences while working with your diligent and resourceful members. Therefore, if I am found eligible, I am ready to avail myself at any time in accordance with your schedule/trend. For some more detailed information, I have enclosed my CV including academic documents, certificates, abstracts of publications and recommendations below. 
I can be reached through my e-mail or cell phone and looking forward for your prompt response. I appreciate your cooperation and consideration in advance.

Best regards!
Amanuel Alemu Abajobir

C U R R I C U L U M   V I T A E
Name  Dr. ATUL  AMBEKAR
Nationality Indian
Date of Birth 17/09/1972
Affiliations • Professor, National Drug Dependence Treatment Centre (NDDTC) and Department of Psychiatry, All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi
• Member, Strategic Advisory Group to United Nations, IDU and HIV 
• Member, Expert Advisory Panel on Drug Dependence, World Health Organization (WHO), Geneva 
• Member, National Technical Resource Group, IDU, National AIDS Control Organisation, Government of India
• Member, National Consultative Committee on Drug De-addiction and Rehabilitation, Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India 
• National Convenor, Addictive Disorders Speciality Section – Indian Psychiatric Society 
Address for correspondence    
 National Drug Dependence Treatment Centre (NDDTC) and Department of Psychiatry,
4th Floor, Teaching Block, 
All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), 
Ansari Nagar, New Delhi, 
India - 110029
Contact Numbers  Mobile: 91-9811155682
Office:  91-11-26593236
Res:        91-11-26105757
Fax:        91-11- 26588641

atul.ambekar@aiims.edu 
Facebook  https://www.facebook.com/atul.ambekar
Skype atul.ambekar

Researchgate:                 https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Atul_Ambekar 
 
AREAS OF INTEREST / EXPERTISE
• Training and human resource development in the area of substance use 
• Treatment of Addictive Disorders 
• Public Health Issues related to Drug Use
• Drug Policies and Programs 
• Prevention of HIV related to substance use – Harm Reduction
• Opioid Substitution Therapy (OST) 
• Epidemiology of drug use and HIV 
• Community based research to facilitate access to services
• Use of Information and Communication Technology in addiction-related issues  
ACADEMIC QUALIFICATION
March 1996, MBBS, Gandhi Medical College, Bhopal, M. P., India First Division
December 1999, MD (Psychiatry), All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi, India, Awarded the prestigious Vidyasagar Gold Medal for best PG student

Melbourne, Australia	            beatrizpayala@yahoo.com

Professional Summary

I am a Peruvian Obstetrician and Gynecologist with relevant clinical work and research experience in maternal and perinatal health research including violence against women and international research collaboration. I have been employed at the General Research Office and Technological Transference of the National Institute of Health in Lima Peru. Presently, I am a PhD candidate at Judith Lumley Centre and my research assesses the influence of violence against women and social determinants of health on severe acute maternal morbidity.

La Trobe University, Melbourne, Australia

column108:
AFSHEEN H. SIDDIQUI, M.B.B.S
8048 Red Jacket way,
Jessup MD 20794
(301) 395-5628
afsheen.zh@gmail.com

Objective:
Seeking a postdoctoral position, that will utilize my qualifications and offer opportunities to apply my strong medical and clinical experience, and also help me achieve my goal of getting into a residency program.

Education:
	Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery M.B.B.S (2004)
University of Health and Sciences (Lahore, Pakistan) in affiliation with University Of Health and Science Center (Houston, Texas)
Punjab Medical College (2004)

	ECFMG Certified
Certification No. 0-693-983-9
Passed: 
o	USMLE Step 1
o	USMLE Step 2CK
o	USMLE Step 2CS

Work Experience:

05/14  12/14   MedStar Franklin Square Medical Center, Baltimore MD	
                             Clinical Externship

I worked as an extern with Dr. Naeem Lughmani to his rounds at the 2T ICU department at Franklin Square Medical Center.  I participated in the morning report set up by the doctors and the nursing staff, and also went over the previously ordered lab works.  I accompanied Dr. Lughmani to his rounds with the patients where we discussed the ongoing patient progress and devised a better future treatment plan for the patients.  I came across different and difficult scenarios and learned how to manage them effectively. This experience provided me an insight on how to tackle those patients who were not in critical condition but at the same not ready to be sent to the wards.  During this time I learned team management and workmanship with the hospital staff.

05/14  12/14   Carroll County Hospital Center, Westminster, MD	
                             Clinical Externship

I worked as an extern with Dr. Naeem Lughmani M.D. at the Carroll County Hospital center.  I actively participated in the morning report and subsequent case discussions.  This experience provided me an opportunity to further enhance my knowledge in medicine by learning new techniques and research.  I was exposed to a broad spectrum of ICU and CCU patients.  I also gained experience in entering and managing patient data using their electronic medical record system.  Overall, this experience greatly augmented my clinical knowledge and practical experience.

05/14  12/14   Institute of Sleep Medicine, Towson, MD 
                             Clinical Externship

I have worked with Dr. Naeem Lughmani M.D. at the Sleep Medicine Clinic located in Towson, MD.  I attended and actively engaged in physicians history taking and patient diagnosis sessions.  I also spent time with the physician in interpreting patients sleep study and CPAP results to help provide the patient with best possible and effective therapy.  This provided me with an opportunity to further develop a good doctor patient relationship and also helped me learn ways to effectively deal with patients from a diverse cultural and socio-economic background. I was able to go through polysomnography results with Dr. Lughmani and deduced the best possible treatment plans for the patients.
                            	
06/10  07/10   Georgetown University Hospital Center, Washington, DC
   Clinical Observer

At Georgetown University Hospital, I got an opportunity to actively participate in morning report cases with the attendings and residents of the Pediatric Department.  I also participated in case discussions and attended the afternoon lectures and conferences.  I gained experience while spending time in taking patient history, performing data entry and learning ways to effectively counsel patients.  This helped me observe diverse and unique cases, along with their best modern treatments.  I also attended the rounds with the faculty members of the PICU (Pediatric Intensive Care Unit), NICU (Neonatal Intensive Care Unit), Pediatric Primary Care Unit, and observed cases which included transplant patients.

04/07  09/09   Dermatology and Dermatologic Surgery Group of Northern
    Virginia 
    Medical Assistant

	Performed routine general examinations of the patients
	Performed bacterial and fungal skin cultures
	Draw blood and performed basic lab work:
o	Filled out the respective lab forms
o	Collected and labeled the specimens
o	Centrifuged the specimen
o	Placed the specimen in special environment as needed
o	Stained the specimen as needed
	Sent out tissue specimens for pathology
	Performed specific lab work for Accutane patients
	Separated and interpreted the lab reports
	Performed pre-operative preparation of patients and medical equipment.
	Assisted the physicians in dermatologic surgeries including:
o	Excisional, Incisional and Punch biopsies
o	Benign skin lesions
o	Superficial skin cancers
o	Surgery for Melanoma 
	Assisted the physicians in Mohs Micrographic surgery and cosmetic repair:
o	Skin grafting
o	Microdermabrasion
o	Skin flap closure
	Performed preoperative and postoperative management of the patient
	Performed wound dressing after surgery with keeping all aseptic measures in mind
	Removed stitches after post-surgical healing
	Managed wound care after infectious wound site or poor healing
	Assisted in Sclerotherapy for varicose veins treatment
	Assisted in botox, restaylane injections
	Assisted in chemical peels, TCA peels and alpha beta peels
	Assist in pulse dye laser procedure
	Performed patch test for skin allergies
	Performed specialized dressings for superficial skin ulcers
	Entered and maintained patient data in their respective files and computer
	Assisted the physicians with paper work
	Conveyed doctors orders to patients
	Counseled the patients as needed
	Kept a regular follow up with patients
                   
07/05  07/06   Medical Group Practice, Arlington, Virginia
   Externship

	Reviewed patients history charts
	Took relevant patient history related to the presenting complaint
	Measured patients vital signs
	Performed Electrocardiography (EKG)
	Performed general physical examination
	Listened and evaluated heart sounds
	Performed chest examination including chest auscultations
	Performed abdominal examination
	Central nervous system (CNS) examination.
	Conveyed all patient complaints in writing to physicians
	Observed the physicians during patient examination, diagnosis and prescribing treatments
	Performed lab work which included:
o	Throat culture for strep test
o	Phlebotomy procedures
o	Pulmonary Function Tests (PFTs)
	Collected and interpreted lab work from previous day
	Assisted the office secretary in maintaining patient data

07/04  07/05   Services Institute of Medical Sciences, Services Hospital
                         (Lahore, Pakistan)
		    House Physician/ Intern, Medical Department
 
I completed one year of house job/internship at the Services Hospital Center, which is a 1100 bed state of the art trauma and research hospital catering to diverse patients especially the poor. During my intern year I served the following duties and responsibilities:
	Taking patient history and physical examination
	SOAP notes
	Morning rounds and case presentation of the assigned patients
	Ordering and performing necessary lab work under medical officers supervision
	Attending bi-weekly clinicopathological case presentations by post graduate trainees
	Writing transfer and discharge summaries
	Participating morning and noon conferences, and presenting the assigned cases
	24 hour ER rotations, ICU rotations and night floats
	Collected data for research purposes
	Managed patients under my assigned supervision
	Follow-up after treatment
	Provided assistance and performed:
o	Upper and lower G.I. Endoscopies
o	Lumber punctures 
o	Thoracic and Abdominal paracentesis 
o	Peritoneal dialysis
o	D/C Cardio version and Defibrillation
o	CPR protocols.
	During my out-patient clinic tenure I independently saw patients, formulated a diagnosis and wrote prescriptions. This provided me sufficient training and opportunity to handle cases without any supervision. This experience also provided me skills necessary to successfully manage stressful situations and handle emotions caused by the most challenging and sometimes traumatic experiences 

05/05- 06/05    Diabetic Management Center, Services Hospital Center
  House Physician/ Intern

Performed one month of service in Diabetic Management Center under Services Institute of Medical Sciences which included:
	Taking history and SOAP notes related to diabetes
	Performing general and specific physical examinations for diabetic patients
	Collecting electronic data for research purposes
	Planning patient treatment according to the guidelines of modern research under supervision of the Head of the Department
	Prescribing anti-diabetic medications and writing discharge slips
	Educating patient in controlling DM through diet and other treatment aspects
	Attending and taking active participation in intradepartmental discussions of complicated diabetic patients
	Follow-up on patients

Volunteer Work:

Humanity First, USA- Medical Volunteer (August, 2014)

Humanity Firsts mission is to serve disaster struck and socially disadvantaged individuals and families in the poorer communities of the world. They aim to:
	Relieve suffering caused by natural disasters and human conflicts
	Promote peace and understanding based on mutual tolerance and respect
	Strengthen peoples capacity to help themselves.

With a team of 20 volunteers that included; two general physicians (including myself), 15 medical students, 1 dentist, 1 dental hygienist and a few administrative support staff, we visited Antigua, Guatemala for a week in August 2014 to provide our free health expertise to the poor community there. We treated almost 3000 patients in a span of one week. We provided free health checkups along with free medicine through the Humanity First pharmacy that was setup in each campsite. The idea was to identify most common illnesses and provide most efficient quickest relief as possible. The plan on large was to educate people about self-hygiene as well make them aware about self-health. 
More information about Humanity First and its mission can be found on their Website at http://usa.humanityfirst.org/index.php

          Community Medicine Volunteer Project (2004):
           
This project was to educate women living in rural areas of Pakistan to practice safe contraceptive methods and help them plan their family effectively.  This project was conducted by the Community Medicine Department during 3rd year of Medical school. We reached out to women who had little or no access to health providers. As I believe that a healthier nation can only be produced if mothers of that nation are educated and are provided with a healthy lifestyle.

GRANT SUPPORT Active: NIH/NINR (Harlow) 7/1/14-12/31/18 .45 Acad months $580,045 The Study of Women's Health A oss the Nation (SWAN) V: Michigan Site This study will extend observations through the late PM, a necessary step to assess the impact of the MT on age-related diseases. The specific goals are to: 1) complete the characterization of the natural history of reproductive aging through the late PM, 2) evaluate the impact of reproductive aging through the late PM on health outcomes clinically relevant to women in their 60s, and 3) identify potential underlying mechanisms linking reproductive aging and health by assessing the relation of inflammation, hemostasis and adipokines to the occurrence and progression of biological, functional and clinical outcomes. vii.	One of the team members that conducted a study/training to some vegetable farmers at the Mokola, Barrack, Ibadan on the use of urine as nutrient supplement for vegetable production. March - June 2009
viii.	One of the collaborators with IFPRI team working on Sustainable Land Management and Institutional Financing in Nigeria. A workshop was conducted in Abuja on January 25, 2009, where I presented a paper on the Extent, Trend and Severity of Land Degradation in Nigeria.
ix.	Principal Consultant to the National Fadama Development Office (NFDO) and Project Coordinating Unit (PCU) on A Study to Define Parameters for a National  SLM Knowledge Base and Define Key Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Indicators and System Parameters March  May 2009.
x.	One of the collaborators with IFPRI team working on Farmers demand for seed and the analysis of gaps in the formal seed sector in Nigeria. August 2009 - February 2010.
xi.	Consultant to the World Bank on Welfare Cost of Risk and Risk Management Options in Nigeria August 8th 2011 to Dec. 2011.

Badbaado Development organization 						Hargeisa 
March 2012  Feb 2013

Duties and Responsibilities 
	Identify and assess the public hygiene risks and needs within the population affected by the emergency as well as the current resources and capacity of beneficiary communities and make recommendations for actions.
	Implement hygiene promotion initiatives appropriate to the context in close collaboration with engineering colleagues to ensure that technical and social aspects of water and sanitation programming are integrated.
	Ensure that all work is carried out in a way that is sensitive to community needs and promotes the full and equal participation of women. As much as possible ensure that an empowering approach to working with communities is employed rather than one that relies on didactic message based methodologies.
	Provide weekly and monthly reports to seniors on hygiene issues and program progress against work plan and program activities.
	Liaise directly with communities, elders and local authorities on hygiene issues, as well as other agencies operational (particularly any carrying out similar activities) regularly to ensure coordination and effective implementation of activities.

	Any other duties as required.

"

P.O. Box 1427-50100, Kakamega, Kenya.

BRENDA ACHIENG OTIENO 
Email: brandyachie@yahoo.c o.uk;


1.    Profile Summary:
 A young, dedicated public health professional with a first degree in BSc. Biomedical sciences and Technology and post-graduate training in Public Health (MPh).
 At  least  6  years  working  experience  implementing  quantitative  and  qualitative  data analysis,   capacity   development,   proposal  development, monitoring     and     evaluation     (M&E), budgeting/financial accounting and nurturing working partnerships between institutions (networking).
    Experience   working with international non-governmental organization (NGO) and
other bilateral agencies including UN Mission in DRC (MONUSCO), UNFPA, UNAIDS, International  HIV/AIDS  Alliance,  David and Lucile Packard Foundation and Regional AIDS Training Network (RATN).
    Experience working with the Ministry of Health in private -public partnership.
    In-depth understanding of health and development issues in the African context.
 Other  areas  of  specialty  include  proficiency  in  Microsoft  Office  Suite  and  statistical packages  SPSS  and Excel,  knowledge  management and rapporteuring.
    My primary interests are in the field of Health and Development with key focus on 
Reproductive, Maternal, Child health  and  rights  (especially  in youths  and marginalized  groups);  Poverty reduction strategies; Research and Advocacy; and Policy formulation  and development.

2.    Academic Background:
Currently:                           Public Health (PhD) Candidate

Award:                               Msc. Public Health (MPH)
University:                        JKUAT/ ITROMID
Year Completed:	   2014


Award:                               Bsc. Biomedical Science and Technology with IT
University:                        Maseno University
Year Completed:             2009


Award:                               O-Level Certificate Secondary School:         Mukumu girls High School Year Completed:             2003


3.    Other Professional trainings:
    Ethical principles & guidelines in Research - CITI Certification (University of Miami).
    Child Protection Policy – I Choose Life Africa/Child Mission International.
 Certificate in M&E Fundamentals   – USAID/John Hopkins Bloomberg  School  of  public health. 
    Certificate in Introduction to M&E of Human Resource for Health – HRH Global Resource
Centre.
    Certificate in M&E Frameworks for HIV/AIDS Programs – USAID/John Hopkins Bloomberg
School of public health.
 Certificate in HIV/AIDS surveillance – USAID/John Hopkins Bloomberg School of public health.
    Certificate in Data Quality - USAID/John Hopkins Bloomberg School of public health.


4.   Publications
a)	Use of Telemedicine in Expanding Access to Sexual and Reproductive Health information and Services among underserved young people living in informal settlements in Kisumu, Kenya – Conference presentation
b)	A postpartum hemorrhage package with condom uterine balloon tamponade: a prospective multi-center case series in Kenya, Sierra Leone, Senegal, and Nepal – Research publication.
c)	Using ‘Holistic Approach’ in Promoting Positive Sexual Reproductive Health Behavior among female youths in Kisumu, Kenya – Conference presentation.
d)	Association  between  oral health  awareness,  perception  and  practice  among  school children in Kibera slums, Nairobi – Thesis.
e)	Training tools (guide and video) on Maternal, Child and Infant hygiene,  feeding  and health for women in developing region – Training Video Co-developed, together with researchers  from Vanderbilt University,  Maseno Hospital and World Health Organization (WHO).


5.    Work Experience:


June, 2014 – Present, 
Research, Monitoring and Evaluation Coordinator,
Kisumu Medical and Educational Trust (KMET),
Serve   as  key  liaison  between  KMET  and international Program/research  Administrators in  coordinating research,  trainings,  and other research activities including data collection, data quality assurance/quality   control  oversight,  design and roll  out  of  new study  instruments, attaining ethical approvals, developing reports, abstracts and publications amongst other tasks.  Key researches coordinated at KMET include:
•	Contextual Analysis on the drivers/barriers to child marriages in Kisumu County – KMET/ICRW.
•	Operational research to expand the use of telemedicine among adolescents and young people in Kisumu – KMET/ASRH Alliance.
•	Longitudinal study on the safety and efficacy of the Uterine Balloon tamponade in the management of post-partum hemorrhage in Kenya – KMET/Massachusetts General Hospital/Havard school of Medicine.

Other M&E duties include providing support to organization and projects in development of monitoring and evaluation plans and frameworks, development and operationalization of quality data management system, reporting to management and generating donor reports, data collection and analysis.





October, 2013 – March, 2014
M&E Officer,
I Choose Life – Africa,
Key responsibilities include providing leadership and  support in project M&E planning  an d design;   Data   management,   Evaluation   and  Reporting;   Resource   mobilization;   Strategic planning; and Capacity building/Mentorship. In addition, support counties and ICL affiliate organizations    in   the   actualization    of   County   strategic   plans   and   organizational development plans respectively. relevant documents are produced for field programs.

•    Proof reading and editing of questionnaires

•    Data collection and presentation

Maseno AIC Hospital/Vanderbilt’s University
A (pilot) study to gather data and determine the amount of knowledge pregnant women and mothers, around Maseno region,  has on maternal and child health issues and then train the mothers and pregnant women on current mate rnal and child health matters. Responsibilities included:

A   collaborative   study   (that   involved   LSHTM -   London,   Royal   Dutch   Tropical   Institute- Amsterdam,  KEMRI-CBDR  and  KCMC-  Tanzania)  that  compared the efficacy of ACT drugs (Coartem and Duocortexin)  and their effect on transmission of malaria in children between the ages of 6 months – 12 years in Mbita. Responsibilities included:

PROFESSIONAL Summary
Dr Khoja is The Head of Public Health Department and Executive Director of the Health and Biomedical Research Center. He is an assistant professor and consultant of Public Health and Family Medicine at College of Medicine, Al-Imam Muhammad Ibn Saud University. In addition, Dr Khoja is a DrPH fellow at department of health policy and management, Johns Hopkins School of Public Health, JHU. He Has the membership of the Royal College of General Practitioners MRCGP(int) and completed both the Saudi and Arab Board of Family Medicine. Moreover, he concluded his Master degree in Business Administration(MBA) and Master of Public health in Health systems and Policy from johns Hopkins School of Public Health.
Dr Abdullah have wide range of skills and experience that developed over the years of education and working with teams and leaders, volunteering, and engaging with community and patients. His skills and interest are mainly connected with the following areas:
- Evidence-based policy development and implementation, concept of “Health in all policy”
- Strategic planning, Intermediate term project execution, Need assessment, Program development, Programs’ Impact Assessment, Project Management, business plans.
- Health systems: Chronic disease models implementations with community integration at primary care levels, health economy and management 
- Epidemiology and Statistic skills: skills in designing and conducting population-based research, Cost-effectiveness, meta-analysis, using qualitative, quantitative and mixed, community participation research. His main research focus is on areas of health service research, primary health care and chronic disease.
- Clinical interest (Chronic Disease, preventive medicine, Geriatric Health, periodic health assessment and Asthma)

culture, and 13th-19th century literature WORK AND RESEARCH EXPERIENCE Educational Fund to Stop Gun Violence June 2015 – Present Public Health Analyst Washington, District of Columbia • Member of the Consortium for Risk-Based Firearm Policy (Consortium) • Collaborate with other members of the Consortium to operationalize the Consortium's recommendations on evidence-based state policies • Maintain subject matter expertise in gun violence prevention research, especially within the areas of mental illness, dangerous behavior, and policy implementation • Create policy documents and reports based column108:
Brief Resume


Dr. Anil Bhansali earned his MD in Internal Medicine  in 1983 from Sawai Man Singh Medical College, Jaipur. Later, he worked in Primary Health Centre in rural areas of Rajasthan for next 4 years.  In 1989, he received his Doctorate in Medicine (DM) in Endocrinology from the premiere institute Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research (PGIMER), Chandigarh and joined as faculty in 1990. Currently, he is the Professor and Head, Department of Endocrinology at the same institute. 
 
He was the Ex-President of the prestigious body of the Endocrinologists of the country (Endocrine Society of India, 2011-12) and the Founder President of the Punjab and Chandigarh Chapter of Research Society of Study of Diabetes in India (RSSDI).

Research in Diabetes and Endocrinology:  

He is pioneer in stem cell therapy in patients with type 2 diabetes in the world.  In addition, his seminal work in diabetic foot including development of indigenous off-loading system and revascularization procedures in patients with diabetes has helped in preventing the amputation in many of them.  He was first to coin the term diabetic hand describing changes in the hands of patients with diabetes and now this has become a part of curriculum in medicine. He was instrumental in establishing the modalities to assess the insulin sensitivity in obese and T2DM patients (clamp studies), first of its kind in India.  This has enabled to understand the pathogenesis of diabetes.  

In addition to diabetes, his other areas of interest include pituitary and adrenal disorders.  His work in this area has garnered him to receive ICMR award for Pituitary Disorders. 

He has published 317 articles in indexed, peer-reviewed, high impact factors journals in the field of Diabetes and Endocrinology.   

Community Services:

The first and foremost duty of a doctor is to provide quality care to the patients and this has been his moto while serving for the last 25 years in Department of Endocrinology, PGIMER, Chandigarh. The Diabetes Clinic and the Endocrine Clinic (Endocrine Clinic: Thyroid Disorders, Reproductive Endocrine Disorders and Pituitary Disorders) serves an OPD of 2500 patients per week, which is the largest OPD run by a single department in any institute in the country.  The patients are catered not only from the neighbouring states, but also from Uttrakhand, Bihar, Jharkhand, Eastern UP and Western Rajasthan, thereby serving almost 9 states of the country.
 
He has passion for teaching and has conducted more than 250 Continuing Medical Education Programmes (CMEs) across the country, to educate and update the doctors in the field of Diabetes, Thyroid disorders and Osteoporosis.  His narrative abilities has helped him to  strike a chord with the audience and marked him as one of the best speaker in medical fraternity.

	In addition to it, he launched a School Health Programme sensitizing and educating the children and adolescents of urban and rural Chandigarh regarding their life style, dietary habits  and prevention of overweight and obesity in these children.  A total of 10,000 students were covered under this programme and educative lectures were deliberated to these children regarding their life style and dietary habits.  

Besides this, he has organized several Diabetes Camps for assessing the prevalence of diabetes in the area of Punjab and Chandigarh under the auspices of Indian Council of Medical Research(ICMR), (ICMR-INDIAB Study),  which has helped to estimate the magnitude of the disease and educating the people for prevention of diabetes. He is the founder Chairman of Association of Diabetes in young in Tricity (ADITI) and actively helping the children with diabetes in their management.

Fellowships and Awards: 

He has been the recipient of many fellowships and awards and few of them include Fellow of Royal College of Physicians (FRCP, Glasgow), Prof. M.N. Sen ICMR award for Pituitary Disorders, Prof. M. Vishwanathan award for Stem Cells therapy in T2DM, Dr. P.N.Shah Memorial Oration Award for Metabolic Bone Disease, and Professor Shurvir Singh Award in Diabetes.  

Administrative Abilities:

He is the executive member of the New Drug Approval Committee (NDAC) and Compensation Decision committee for Clinical Drug Trials constituted by Drug Controller General of India (DCGI) and empowered by Member of Parliamentary Board.  This has led to streamlining of guidelines for Clinical Trials and Compensation to the deceased in Clinical Trials.  He has been the resource person for majority of Research Committees under the auspices of Indian Council of Medical Research(ICMR) India.

C- Fellowship:



	July 2003- 2006, I’ve joint Pediatric Critical Care Medicine Fellowship at McGill University, Montreal Children Hospital. The PICU there is equipped with (12) acute care beds and (4) step down beds, and is staffed with (7) qualified pediatric intensivest. The average admission rate is 500 cases per year including 200-250 complex congenital heart disease.

	 I was involved actively and directly in evaluating and managing acutely ill children. I assumed the role of team leader during unite rounds and cardiac arrest codes.

	Procedures: during this period, I was able to practice different procedures necessary for PICU career. This includes 

•	Central venous access

•	Intubations

•	Chest tubes 

•	Peritoneal  & pericardial centhesis 

•	Procedural sedation.

	Also, I had the opportunity to gain experience in 

•	Extra Corporeal Membrane Oxygenation (ECMO) / Extracorporeal Life Support   (ECLS)

•	 Continuous Renal Replacement Therapy (CRRT)

•	Left Ventricular Assisted Device (LVAD) 

•	Berlin’s Heart

	I was pleased to interact with different subspecialties and collaborate with different institutions. This has improved my administrative, collaborative and communication skills.

	Also, I was pleased to interact with available experts in medical education which enriches my experience in this field and activate my interest in teaching and education.

column108:
CURRICULUM VITAE

1.	PERSONAL DATA

Name: Birhan Mengistu

Place of birth: Grawa

Date of birth: Dec 16, 1980

Sex: M

Nationality: Ethiopia

Family status: married and father of two children



2.	EDUCATIONAL BACK GROUND

Primary: 1-8 in Grawa primary and junior secondary school 1983-1994.

Secondary: 9-12 in Grawa senior secondary school 1995-1998.

Higher Education: in Alemaya University B.Sc. in public health in 2002, and B.A. degree in Economics from Haramaya University in 2010.

Postgraduate: I have Master in public health from Gondar University in 2010.



3.	EXPERIENCE

3.1 Capacity building manager at Federal Ministry of Health, Ethiopia since January 2016 till now

 Duties and responsibilities

•	Assist the FMOH as requested on the planning, implementation, and evaluation of the national-scale schistosomiasis and STH programme.

•	Support the FMOH in the planning, implementation, and evaluation of other NTD control programmes

•	Support the FMOH to identify and exploit opportunities to increase the integration of NTD programmes, as well as with water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) services and programmes from other sectors.

•	Develop NTDs capacity building strategies for all levels (federal, regional, zonal, and district) across all 5 programme outputs:

o	Conduct effective national programme management, 

o	Set up, trigger and manage the training cascade, 

o	Professionally oversee drug procurement and distribution,

o	Identify and deliver effective community mobilization strategy,

o	Collect and use data to inform and improve programme design.



3.2 NTD officer in Federal Ministry of Health, Ethiopia from Oct. 1 2014 to Dec. 31, 2015

Duties and responsibilities

•	Provides technical assistance to the Ministry of Health in the development of proposals, work plans, budgets, and forecasting of NTD drugs, diagnostics and supplies

•	Provides support in the rollout of NTDs and the scale-up of preventive chemotherapy (PCT) NTD services

•	Supports the timely implementation, integration and smooth operation of NTD Master Plan activities, ensuring they are implemented in accordance with work plan and budget

•	Assists the FMOH in the development of a national, integrated M&E NTD database and participate in routine data management and analysis

•	Supports program monitoring and evaluation, disease mapping, routine program surveys and operational research on NTDs in collaboration with the Federal Ministry of Health and other stakeholders

•	Supports the development/adaptation of training materials and guidelines for NTDs and Participate in the preparations and organization of Regional and District training activities, and follow up assessment of trainees and facilitators to ensure quality of training and performance

•	Builds partnerships for planning and resource mobilization for NTD program implementation by serving as a support liaison between the NTD Unit, program partners, and national and international donors and organizations, facilitate NTD meetings and events

•	Participate in the development and continual refinement of national NTD training materials and guidelines,

•	Travels to regions/ zones and districts for supportive supervision and other technical assistance and

3.3 Senior HIV Mainstreaming specialist and communication lead in NASTAD Ethiopia (Oct 1, 2013 June 30, 2014)

Duties and responsibilities

o	Develop overall goals and objectives for the NASTAD Ethiopia program.

o	Develop annual national and region-specific work-plans in support of HAPCO/HB to mainstream HIV in the system.

o	Maintain ongoing collaborations and communications with the federal and regional HAPCOs and Health Bureaus.

o	In collaboration with the regional HAPCO/HB, initiates and assesses the HIV mainstreaming needs of the region and develops relevant, evidenced-based strategies and interventions.

o	In collaboration with federal and regional HAPCOs, actively engages in integrating prevention into Social Mobilization and supporting mainstreaming activities with sector bureaus and universities, Implementing Partners.

o	Serve as a consultant and advisor to other NASTAD Ethiopia staff, and assists in integrating effective HIV mainstreaming activities in to planning, coordination, supportive supervision, and monitoring.

o	Support the regional HAPCO/HB in the development and implementation of a monitoring and evaluation system to track the implementation of HIV activities identified in the regional plan in the regions and documents progress being made.

o	Lead the implementation of mainstreaming and HIV/STI prevention intervention government and private higher education institutions

o	Involve in operational research (organized youth risk behavioral survey among University students and Use of mobile SMS as HIV/STI prevention method) 

o	Regularly chronicle the Country Program field offices’ activities, successes, and lessons learned using social Medias and other channels.  

o	Promote the Country Program’s scope of work and expertise among key partners, stakeholders, and funders. 

o	Facilitate communication and information sharing between NASTAD field offices.

3.4 Senior HIV/STI prevention and control specialist in NASTAD Ethiopia (July 1, 2011 till Sep. 30 2013)

Duties and responsibilities

o	Develop overall goals and objectives for the NASTAD Ethiopia program.

o	Develop annual national and region-specific work-plans in support of HAPCO/HB for social mobilization and community-based prevention activities that is incorporated in the regional work plans.

o	Maintain ongoing collaborations and communications with the federal and regional HAPCOs and Health Bureaus.

o	In collaboration with the regional HAPCO/HB, initiates and assesses the prevention needs of the region and specific populations, and develops relevant, evidenced-based strategies and interventions.

o	Initiate and supports the identification of populations, and develops relevant BCC and IEC materials.

o	Promote and support HCT and PMTCT activities as an entry point for prevention.

o	Work closely with JHU CCP – NARC and organizes social marketing and prevention campaigns for the focus regions.

o	In collaboration with federal and regional HAPCOs, actively engages in integrating prevention into Social Mobilization and supporting mainstreaming activities with sector bureaus and universities.

o	Develop an implementation plan for promoting AB as one strategy of addressing the prevention needs of the country.

o	In consultation with the Country Director, collaborates with relevant PEPFAR partners to synergize prevention activities and messaging at federal and regional levels.

o	Lead application process, implementation, technical assistance, and monitoring of prevention activities provided through community-based Implementing Partners.

o	Serve as a consultant and advisor to other NASTAD Ethiopia staff, and assists in integrating effective prevention messaging and evidenced-based prevention activities into planning, coordination, supportive supervision, and monitoring.

o	Support the regional HAPCO/HB in the development and implementation of a monitoring and evaluation system to track the implementation of HIV activities identified in the regional plan in the regions and documents progress being made.

o	Lead the implementation of mainstreaming and HIV/STI prevention intervention in six government and private higher education institutions

o	Design and lead strategies to improve maternal and child health including PMTCT

o	Involve in operational research (organized youth risk behavioral survey among University students and Use of mobile SMS as HIV/STI prevention method)



3.5	HIV/STI prevention technical officer in NASTAD Ethiopia (March to June 2011)

      Duties and responsibilities

o	Work with the federal/regional HAPCO and HB to support regional planning, monitoring and coordination activities

o	Develop annual national and region specific prevention work plan in support of HAPCO/HB, monitoring and evaluation and quality assurance that includes NASTAD activities (i.e. twinning partnerships, TA capacity building efforts and community planning trainings) 

o	Participates in the initiation and assessment of prevention needs of the NASTAD focus regions and specific populations, and develops relevant, evidenced-based strategies and interventions in collaboration with regional/zonal/woreda HAPCOs and Health Bureaus/Offices and the NASTAD Regional Coordinators and Project Officers 

o	Initiate, maintain and coordinate relationships with all regional implementing and funding partners through establishment or support of existing funding system 

o	Proactively establish and maintain ongoing collaborations and communications with the federal/regional HAPCO/HB

o	Assists in the identification of most at risk populations, and actively involves in the development of relevant BCC and IEC materials. 

o	Promotes and support HCT and PMTCT activities as an entry point for prevention. 

o	In collaboration with federal and regional HAPCOs, actively engages in integrating prevention into Social Mobilization and supporting mainstreaming activities with sector bureaus and universities

o	Assists in application process, implementation, technical assistance, and monitoring of prevention activities provided through community-based Implementing Partners 



3.6 Regional coordinator of NASTAD Ethiopia in Dire Dawa (Dec. 2009 –Feb. 2011)

      Duties and responsibilities

	Coordinate prevention, ART adherence, community information system and capacity building program in the region

	Coordinate community outreach and social mobilization to increase the uptake of ANC/PMTCT

	Provide regular follow up for implementing partners in the region to pilot using TBA as VCAP to promote ANC/PMTCT

	Coordinate community outreach and social mobilization for Bajaj/Taxi drivers on HIV/STI prevention and road safety

	Organize a regional panel discussion for 1000 pregnant mothers and other delegates on PMTCT in the presence of Ethiopia’s first lady

	Supporte quality social mobilization implementation strategy in the region (organized, facilitated and conducted trainings, meetings and supportive supervision on HIV/STI prevention, Basic CC, CC review meeting, VCAPs, Mainstreaming, CC program management, and ART adherence)

	Actively assist the implementation of evidence based intervention (Sister to Sister) in health facilities in the region

	Actively support and led the youth behavioural survey in Dire Dawa University including orientation and production of Billboard for the University community

	Actively represent the organization in different networking and task forces of the region (Some of these are: member of regional PMTCT task force, member of  regional VCT advisory board, member of regional HAPCO review board, member of NEP+ DD executive board)

3.7	Head of family guidance association in Dire Dawa sub branch(Nov. 2006 –Dec. 2009)

      Duties and responsibilities

•	Responsible for clinical services of sexual reproductive health in the sub branch

•	Plan, directs and guides all clinical activities and assure quality of care provided

•	Monitors/supervises and evaluate all clinical activities in collaboration with supervisors

•	Organizes/provides onsite and other clinical training

•	Be involved in operational research

•	Propose and advocate policy issue



3.8	Head of Family guidance association of Ethiopia in Jijiga sub-branch(Dec.2004-Oct. 2006)

      Duties and responsibilities

•	Responsible for clinical services of sexual reproductive health youth center

•	Responsible for ensuring the standards/norms and ethics of clinical performance of the youth center

•	Plan, directs and guides all clinical activities and assure quality of care provided

•	Monitors/supervises and evaluate all clinical activities in collaboration with supervisors

•	Organizes/provides onsite and other clinical training

•	Be involved in operational research



3.9	Assistant physician in Bilal hospital Dire Dawa (March 2004 – Nov. 2004)

      Duties and responsibilities

•	Manage case in emergency, inpatient and outpatient department

•	Prepare health learning materials

•	Responsible for coordinating appropriate waste management

3.10	Academic dean in Dire health college, Dire Dawa (Dec. 2003 – Feb. 2004

      Duties and responsibilities

•	Prepare over all academic plan

•	Responsible for implementing, coordinating and monitoring the activities of the college

•	Lecture some courses like Microbiology and health education

3.11	Head of Bedeno health center (Aug. 2002 – Dec. 2003)

      Duties and responsibilities

•	Prepare all financial and physical plans for the health center

•	Responsible for implementing, coordinating and monitoring the health center              activities

•	Supervise health posts and clinics under the health center

•	Responsible for control of disease outbreak in the wereda

•	Liaison person with stake holders to improve and strengthen the quality of services in

CARRICULUM VITAE (CV)

I.	Personal Data

1.	Name: Alemayehu Bekele Mengesha

2.	Contact Address : Ethiopian Public Health Association, Meskel Flower

                                                      Addis Ababa, Ethiopia
                                                      Telephone- +251 911 179205(Mobile)

                                                                  alemayehubekele2002@gmail.com 
                  3. Sex: Male
                  4. Date of Birth:  16 March 1975 G.C
                  5. Place of Birth:  Addis Ababa
                  6. Nationality: Ethiopian
                  7. Religion: Orthodox Christian
                  8. Marital status: Married and have two children
                  9. Language skills: Amharic
                                                 English
                                                 Oromigna (Little) 
______________________________________________________________________
II.	Educational Background
	2012 up until now- PhD student at the University of South Africa
	2005-2007 G.C MPH in Epidemiology from Addis Ababa University
	2000-2003 G.C Bachelor of Science (BSc) in Public Health from Jimma University
	1993-1995 G.C Diploma in Comprehensive Nursing from Gondar University
______________________________________________________________________

III.	Work Experience 

1.	April 2015 to now - Acting Director for Projects Management Department, EPHA,
	Coordinates and leads all projects in the department
	Monitors the performance of sub grantees for programmatic compliance 
	Receives activity reports and evaluate performance
	Participates in management committee meetings
	Deals with partners on various strategic issues
	Represents the institution in high level meetings
2.	April 2011 to present Projects Coordinator, EPHA. I had the following roles in this position:
	Developed annual plans for EFETP and other projects; 
	Carryout routine EFETP and other projects coordination activities;
	Participated in the preparation of strategic plan for EFETP; 
	Coordination of field supervisory activities; 
	Development of EFETP information bulletin, resident and supervisors and mentors manuals;
	Development of EFETP operation manual and annual progress report bulletin
	I have a mentorship role and sometimes provide lecture for the EFETP residents 
	I participated in scorecard evaluation and self-assessment  of the EFETP 
	I am the secretary and member of the Advisory Council for EFETP; 
	I am the secretary and member of Technical Working Group for EFETP, 
	I am one of the authors for training manual on basic epidemiology training for surveillance officers, Coordination of EFETP training modules development,
	Actively participated in the proposal development of the EPHA and CDC new coag;
	Participated in the preparation of other project proposals for funding
	 Provided  technical assistance to other projects being implemented by the EPHA
	Assisting and supervising the EFETP residents in outbreak investigation (Measles, Meningitis, Malaria, Dengue fever. Rubella etc.) and surveillance Data analysis and surveillance system evaluation of Measles, Malaria, Leishmaniasis Rabies and the like.
	I also provided mentorship support to the LSI trainees;
	In Addition to the aforementioned activities, I have the following contributions at    EPHA since 2011
Extra responsibilities at EPHA and  EPHA representations in various National Committees and Taskforces
S.No 	Organization/Institution 	Activities 	Role and Responsibilities
1	MOH, Universities , others	A member of the One Health country coordinating committee	Member
2	MOH, EPHI, Universities, MOA	A technical team member of one health model on Rabies elimination	Member
3	MOH, EPHI, Universities, EPHA	National steps wise survey on Non-communicable Diseases risk factors in Ethiopia	A steering committee member and co-investigator 
4	EAS, EPHI, AAU-SPH	Human Health: Impacts, Adaptation and Co-Benefits of Climate Change in Ethiopia: 
Ethiopia panel for  climate and Health (EPCC)-development of synthesis on climate and health	Author
5	EPHA, HPP/Futures Group. MOH, Amhara region health bureau, MOFED, BOFED, Universities	HPP-EPHA project on capacity development through spectrum suite model training and evidence generation	Training Coordinator,  Focal person, trainer, mentor,
Mentors manager
6	EPHA	EPHA Internal scientific committee for research and Ethics	Chairperson 
7	EFMHACA, EPHA, Universities, MOH, etc	A national committee for Tobacco control	Member

10	WHO and EPHA	Synthesis on TB related researches	Writer 
11	EPHI, WHO, EPHA, CDC, EFMHACA and Others 	Surveillance and Laboratory Strengthening Subcommittee on Ebola Virus Disease  	Member 

3.	January 2010  March 2011 Strategic Information (SI) Capacity Building Officer, Ethiopian Public Health Association (EPHA) with the 
                          following roles and responsibilities:
o	Coordination of the EFETP and Leadership in Strategic Information (LSI) Training Program. 
o	I was mentoring LSI Trainees. 
o	I played a leading role in expanding LSI training program to other Universities like Jimma and Gondar Universities. 
o	I was a member and a secretary of the steering committee for LSI.
o	I developed a Term of Reference for the evaluation of LSI training program 
o	I  reviewed the proposal developed by the consultant for the LSI training program. 
o	I organized a short term training on TB and HIV collaborative activities in collaboration with the Federal Ministry of Health and
o	Prepares and submits quarterly and annual reports of the programs and other reports as deemed necessary

4.	2007-2009 G.C  Administrative and Development/Academic and Research Vice Dean of Hawassa College of Health Sciences. I had the following roles and responsibilities in this position. 
	Responsible for assisting the Dean of the college in all matters regarding academic and research affairs
	Guiding the departments to achieve the desired goals of the academic institution
	Supervising the academic delivery of the college
	Strengthening the research undertaking by the teaching staffs and the students
	Participating in the Academic commission meeting of the college
	Undertaking other related activities as delegated by the college dean
	Working with Regional Health Bureau of SNNPR on different issues like Epidemic investigation and different surveillance issues
	Provision of Training for front line health workers on Outbreak investigation, Surveillance,  Malnutrition, immunization programs, IMCI  and Cold chain system
	A member of the Academic Commission of the college and senior management committee member of the college. 
	I represented the college in various issues at higher management level. 

5.	2003-2005 G.C- Lecturer and Head, Department of Public Health, Hawassa College of Health Sciences. I had the following roles and 
                            responsibilities:
	Developing weekly schedule for classroom teachings
	Plans for annual activities to be undertaken by the department
	Assign Instructors for class room teachings and field activity Supervision
	Giving lectures for Students and supervising them on field activities
	Working with Regional Health Bureau of SNNPR on different issues like Epidemic investigation of AWD and measles and Polio surveillance 
	I was a member of the Academic Commission of the college
	I represented the department in all matters related to public health training.
	I developed training materials and provided courses on public health courses like Epidemiology, Reproductive Health, Human Nutrition and Biostatistics.

6.	1995-1998 G.C A clinician and Head of a Health Center.  I had following      
                            roles and responsibilities:
	Treating patients at the outpatient department
	Plans and supervises the overall Public Health activitis of the Health center
	Working as surveillance officer of the health center for Polio and measles and other reportable health problems
	Monitoring and evaluating  the routine Immunization schedule for under 1 children 
	Coordinating and supervising the campaign for National Immunization days for polio in the catchment area of the health center in collaboration with District Health Office
	Provision of training for Health workers on Cold chain Management, Malnutrition and Malaria
	Screening of children with malnutrition and treating them accordingly;
